dca-mode.description:
Dynamic channel assignment(DCA) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the channel assignment will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DCA is run once, channel assignments are updated based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DCA is static, no dynamic channel assignments occurs and value are set to their global default. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic Channel selection
         rrm-run-once = Channel selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static channel selection

dca-update-interval-sec.description: When Channel dynamic algorithm is running, this interval (in seconds) specifies how often Channel assignment updates are attempted on an Access Point. NOTE: hysteresis is built into the algorithms so we will not have unproductive changes occuring. Default value is 600 seconds

dca-contribution-noise.description:
State of noise on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled

dca-contribution-interference.description:
State of interference on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

dca-contribution-load.description:
State of load on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

dca-contribution-device.description:
State of device detection on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

txpower-mode.description:
Dynamic transmit power (DTP) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the transmit power of each Access Point will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DTP is run once,transmit power update will occur based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DTP is static, no dynamic transmit power updates occur and their global defaults are used. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic power selection
         rrm-run-once = Power selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static power selection

monitor-channel-mode.description:
Channels on which the switch monitors noise, interference and rogues.
         Possible values:
         rrm-channels-country = Monitoring on channels that are supported by the country of operation,
         rrm-channels-all = Monitoring on all channels,
         rrm-channels-dca = Monitoring on those channels that are used by automatic channel assignment

monitor-rssi-normalization.description: 802.11 configured RRM Neighbor Discovery RSSI Normalization

channel-monitor-status.description:
Neighbor monitoring mode.
         True - monitoring is disabled
         False - monitoring is enabled

monitor-load-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) specifying how often we get new load measurements at each Access Point. Default is 300 seconds

monitor-coverage-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) specifying how often we get new coverage measurements at each Access Point. Default is 300 seconds

ndp-type-data.description:
Mode of NDP.
         Possible values:
         transparent = NDP mode is transparent
         protected = NDP mode is protected

roaming-en.description:
Optimized roaming mode.
         True - optimized roaming is enabled
         False - optimized roaming is disabled

data-rate-threshold.description:
This attribute indicates configured data rate threshold for 802.11 Optimized Roaming
         optroam-rate-1-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 1 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-2-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 2 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-5-5-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 5 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-6-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 6 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-9-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 9 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-11-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 11 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-12-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 12 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-18-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 18 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-24-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 24 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-36-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 36 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-48-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 48 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-54-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 54 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-0 = Data rate threshold will be set to 0 Mbps.

roaming-hysteresis.description: Hysteresis for optimized roaming. Recommended range is 3 dBm to 6 dBm.

rrm-meas-req-state.description: Support of 802.11 CCX Client Location Measurements

dca-long-interval.description: DCA interval value in hours. Possible values are 1,2,3,4,6,8,12 and 24 hours, 0 = 10 minutes (default).

dca-anchor-hour.description: Anchor time for DCA, hour of the day. Valid value should be in the range 0-23

dca-threshold.description:
Dynamic Channel Assignment sensitivity level to change in the environment
         dca-threshold-low = Low DCA sensitivity level.
         dca-threshold-medium = Medium DCA sensitivity level.
         dca-threshold-high = High DCA sensitivity level

coverage-global-enable.description:
State of CHD (Coverage Hole Detection) on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled

coverage-data-failed-packet-count.description: Minimum threshold on the Data packet count required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-data-failed-packet-percentage.description: Threshold on the percent of Data packets dropped, that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-data-packet-rssi-threshold.description:
RSSI threshold value for Data packets,
         that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.
         Use coverage-data-packet-rssi-threshold, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

coverage-voice-failed-packet-count.description: Minimum threshold on the Voice packet count required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-voice-failed-packet-percentage.description: Threshold on the percent of Voice packets dropped, that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-voice-packet-rssi-threshold.description:
RSSI threshold value for Voice packets,
         that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.
         Use coverage-voice-packet-rssi-threshold, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

dca-chan-width.description:
DCA channel width selection.
         Possible values:
         dca-chan-width-20mhz = Channel width will be set to 20Mhz
         dca-chan-width-40mhz = Channel width will be set to 40Mhz
         dca-chan-width-80mhz = Channel width will be set to 80Mhz
         dca-chan-width-best = Best channel width will be selected by DCA algorithm
         dca-chan-width-160mhz = Channel width will be set to 160Mhz
         Use rf-dca-chan-width, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

reporting-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) between each measurements report.

notification-tx-power-enable.description:
Transmission power change notification mode.
         True - notification is enabled
         False - notification is disabled

notification-min-tx-power-threshold.description: Minimum threshold that the TPC will assign to each radio

notification-max-tx-power-threshold.description: Maximum threshold that the TPC will assign to each radio

notification-channel-enable.description:
Channel change notification mode.
         True - notification will be sent
         False - notification will not be sent

notification-channel-threshold.description: Number of channel changes after which the channel change notification is sent out.

dpc-min-tx-power-limit.description: Lower limit of transmit power in dBm. The value should be less than equal to value of tx-power-max.

dpc-max-tx-power-limit.description: Upper limit of transmit power in dBm. The value should be greater than equal to value of tx-power-min.

dca-min-metric-rssi.description: Minimum RSSI energy metric required for DCA to change the channel

chan-width-cap.description: Max Best Channel Width Allowed for Dynamic Bandwidth Selection. Possible values are 20,40,80 and 160 MHZ

measurement-interval.description: Interval (in seconds) specifying how often we get new signal strength, noise and interference measurements at each Access Point.

neighbor-timeout-factor.description: Factor specifying how long a neighbor expires if not receiving its neighbor packets.

bss-color-mode.description: BSS Color Optimization (BCO) has two modes. When the mode is auto, the BSS color will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the BCO is static, no dynamic BSS color selections occur and BSS color must be manually configured.

dca-aggr-startup.description: Aggressive DCA algorithm is run on WLC startup when enabled

exception-level.description:
Minimum percentage of clients in the coverage hole region of the AP,
         required to trigger a coverage hole exception.
         Use exception-level, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

min-num-clients.description:
Minimum number of clients required to trigger coverage hole.
         Use min-num-clients, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

automatic-cfg.description:
Performance profile Mode.
         True - Performance profile is enabled
         False - Performance profile is disabled

ip.description: IP address of the static member configured

name.description: Name of the static member configured

band.description:
Key to the st_rrm_mgr table ,indicates the band of the configurations.
         Possible values:
         ewlc-dot11-2-dot-4-ghz-band = 802.11bg
         ewlc-dot11-5-ghz-band = 802.11a

grouping-mode.description:
RF grouping has three modes. When RF grouping is set to AUTO the controller can be either in Auto leader or Auto member and when the mode is set to static the controller can be either in static member or static leader.
         Possible values:
         rrm-automatic = RF leader selected automatically
         rrm-static = RF leader selection is stopped
         rrm-leader = RF leader selection is static, and set this controller as group leader

grouping-update-interval-sec.description: The period used by the grouping algorithm. The grouping algorithm runs when the group contents changes and automatic grouping is enabled. The system administrator can start grouping on demand.

exception-level.description:
Minimum percentage of clients in the coverage hole region of the AP,

ip.description: IP address of the static member configured

name.description: Name of the static member configured

grouping-mode.description:
RF grouping has three modes. When RF grouping is set to AUTO the controller can be either in Auto leader or Auto member and when the mode is set to static the controller can be either in static member or static leader.
         Possible values:
         rrm-automatic = RF leader selected automatically
         rrm-static = RF leader selection is stopped
         rrm-leader = RF leader selection is static, and set this controller as group leader

grouping-update-interval-sec.description: The period used by the grouping algorithm. The grouping algorithm runs when the group contents changes and automatic grouping is enabled. The system administrator can start grouping on demand.

band.description:
Key to the st_rrm_mgr table ,indicates the band of the configurations.
         Possible values:
         ewlc-dot11-2-dot-4-ghz-band = 802.11bg
         ewlc-dot11-5-ghz-band = 802.11a

grouping-mode.description:
RF grouping has three modes. When RF grouping is set to AUTO the controller can be either in Auto leader or Auto member and when the mode is set to static the controller can be either in static member or static leader.
         Possible values:
         rrm-automatic = RF leader selected automatically
         rrm-static = RF leader selection is stopped
         rrm-leader = RF leader selection is static, and set this controller as group leader

grouping-update-interval-sec.description: The period used by the grouping algorithm. The grouping algorithm runs when the group contents changes and automatic grouping is enabled. The system administrator can start grouping on demand.

dca-mode.description:
Dynamic channel assignment(DCA) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the channel assignment will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DCA is run once, channel assignments are updated based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DCA is static, no dynamic channel assignments occurs and value are set to their global default. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic Channel selection
         rrm-run-once = Channel selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static channel selection

dca-update-interval-sec.description: When Channel dynamic algorithm is running, this interval (in seconds) specifies how often Channel assignment updates are attempted on an Access Point. NOTE: hysteresis is built into the algorithms so we will not have unproductive changes occuring. Default value is 600 seconds

dca-contribution-noise.description:
State of noise on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled

dca-contribution-interference.description:
State of interference on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

dca-contribution-load.description:
State of load on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

dca-contribution-device.description:
State of device detection on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

txpower-mode.description:
Dynamic transmit power (DTP) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the transmit power of each Access Point will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DTP is run once,transmit power update will occur based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DTP is static, no dynamic transmit power updates occur and their global defaults are used. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic power selection
         rrm-run-once = Power selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static power selection

monitor-channel-mode.description:
Channels on which the switch monitors noise, interference and rogues.
         Possible values:
         rrm-channels-country = Monitoring on channels that are supported by the country of operation,
         rrm-channels-all = Monitoring on all channels,
         rrm-channels-dca = Monitoring on those channels that are used by automatic channel assignment

monitor-rssi-normalization.description: 802.11 configured RRM Neighbor Discovery RSSI Normalization

channel-monitor-status.description:
Neighbor monitoring mode.
         True - monitoring is disabled
         False - monitoring is enabled

         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

txpower-mode.description:
Dynamic transmit power (DTP) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the transmit power of each Access Point will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DTP is run once,transmit power update will occur based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DTP is static, no dynamic transmit power updates occur and their global defaults are used. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic power selection
         rrm-run-once = Power selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static power selection

monitor-channel-mode.description:
Channels on which the switch monitors noise, interference and rogues.
         Possible values:
         rrm-channels-country = Monitoring on channels that are supported by the country of operation,
         rrm-channels-all = Monitoring on all channels,
         rrm-channels-dca = Monitoring on those channels that are used by automatic channel assignment

monitor-rssi-normalization.description: 802.11 configured RRM Neighbor Discovery RSSI Normalization

channel-monitor-status.description:
Neighbor monitoring mode.
         True - monitoring is disabled
         False - monitoring is enabled

monitor-load-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) specifying how often we get new load measurements at each Access Point. Default is 300 seconds

monitor-coverage-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) specifying how often we get new coverage measurements at each Access Point. Default is 300 seconds

sys-log-load.description:
Logging mode for load profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-noise.description:
Logging mode for noise profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-foreign.description:
Logging mode for foreign profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-tx-power.description:
Logging mode for transmit power change.

         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-coverage.description:
Logging mode for coverage profile.

         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-performance.description:
Logging mode for performance profile.

         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-channel.description:
Logging mode for dynamic channel change.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

ndp-type-data.description:
Mode of NDP.
         Possible values:
         transparent = NDP mode is transparent
         protected = NDP mode is protected

roaming-en.description:
Optimized roaming mode.
         True - optimized roaming is enabled
         False - optimized roaming is disabled

data-rate-threshold.description:
This attribute indicates configured data rate threshold for 802.11 Optimized Roaming
         optroam-rate-1-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 1 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-2-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 2 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-5-5-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 5 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-6-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 6 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-9-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 9 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-11-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 11 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-12-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 12 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-18-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 18 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-24-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 24 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-36-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 36 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-48-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 48 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-54-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 54 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-0 = Data rate threshold will be set to 0 Mbps.

roaming-hysteresis.description: Hysteresis for optimized roaming. Recommended range is 3 dBm to 6 dBm.

rrm-meas-req-state.description: Support of 802.11 CCX Client Location Measurements

dca-long-interval.description: DCA interval value in hours. Possible values are 1,2,3,4,6,8,12 and 24 hours, 0 = 10 minutes (default).

dca-anchor-hour.description: Anchor time for DCA, hour of the day. Valid value should be in the range 0-23

dca-threshold.description:
Dynamic Channel Assignment sensitivity level to change in the environment
         dca-threshold-low = Low DCA sensitivity level.
         dca-threshold-medium = Medium DCA sensitivity level.
         dca-threshold-high = High DCA sensitivity level

coverage-global-enable.description:
State of CHD (Coverage Hole Detection) on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled

coverage-data-failed-packet-count.description: Minimum threshold on the Data packet count required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-data-failed-packet-percentage.description: Threshold on the percent of Data packets dropped, that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-data-packet-rssi-threshold.description:
RSSI threshold value for Data packets,
         that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.
         Use coverage-data-packet-rssi-threshold, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

coverage-voice-failed-packet-count.description: Minimum threshold on the Voice packet count required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-voice-failed-packet-percentage.description: Threshold on the percent of Voice packets dropped, that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-voice-packet-rssi-threshold.description:
RSSI threshold value for Voice packets,
         that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.
         Use coverage-voice-packet-rssi-threshold, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

dca-chan-width.description:
DCA channel width selection.
         Possible values:
         dca-chan-width-20mhz = Channel width will be set to 20Mhz
         dca-chan-width-40mhz = Channel width will be set to 40Mhz
         dca-chan-width-80mhz = Channel width will be set to 80Mhz
         dca-chan-width-best = Best channel width will be selected by DCA algorithm
         dca-chan-width-160mhz = Channel width will be set to 160Mhz
         Use rf-dca-chan-width, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

reporting-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) between each measurements report.

notification-tx-power-enable.description:
Transmission power change notification mode.
         True - notification is enabled
         False - notification is disabled

notification-min-tx-power-threshold.description: Minimum threshold that the TPC will assign to each radio

notification-max-tx-power-threshold.description: Maximum threshold that the TPC will assign to each radio

notification-channel-enable.description:
Channel change notification mode.
         True - notification will be sent
         False - notification will not be sent

notification-channel-threshold.description: Number of channel changes after which the channel change notification is sent out.

dpc-min-tx-power-limit.description: Lower limit of transmit power in dBm. The value should be less than equal to value of tx-power-max.

dpc-max-tx-power-limit.description: Upper limit of transmit power in dBm. The value should be greater than equal to value of tx-power-min.

dca-min-metric-rssi.description: Minimum RSSI energy metric required for DCA to change the channel

chan-width-cap.description: Max Best Channel Width Allowed for Dynamic Bandwidth Selection. Possible values are 20,40,80 and 160 MHZ

measurement-interval.description: Interval (in seconds) specifying how often we get new signal strength, noise and interference measurements at each Access Point.

neighbor-timeout-factor.description: Factor specifying how long a neighbor expires if not receiving its neighbor packets.

bss-color-mode.description: BSS Color Optimization (BCO) has two modes. When the mode is auto, the BSS color will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the BCO is static, no dynamic BSS color selections occur and BSS color must be manually configured.

dca-aggr-startup.description: Aggressive DCA algorithm is run on WLC startup when enabled

exception-level.description:
Minimum percentage of clients in the coverage hole region of the AP,
         required to trigger a coverage hole exception.
         Use exception-level, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

min-num-clients.description:
Minimum number of clients required to trigger coverage hole.
         Use min-num-clients, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

automatic-cfg.description:
Performance profile Mode.
         True - Performance profile is enabled
         False - Performance profile is disabled

ip.description: IP address of the static member configured

name.description: Name of the static member configured

band.description: Key to the st_rrm table, indicates the band of the configurations.

dca-mode.description:
Dynamic channel assignment(DCA) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the channel assignment will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DCA is run once, channel assignments are updated based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DCA is static, no dynamic channel assignments occurs and value are set to their global default. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic Channel selection
         rrm-run-once = Channel selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static channel selection

dca-update-interval-sec.description: When Channel dynamic algorithm is running, this interval (in seconds) specifies how often Channel assignment updates are attempted on an Access Point. NOTE: hysteresis is built into the algorithms so we will not have unproductive changes occuring. Default value is 600 seconds

dca-mode.description:
Dynamic channel assignment(DCA) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the channel assignment will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DCA is run once, channel assignments are updated based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DCA is static, no dynamic channel assignments occurs and value are set to their global default. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic Channel selection
         rrm-run-once = Channel selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static channel selection

dca-update-interval-sec.description: When Channel dynamic algorithm is running, this interval (in seconds) specifies how often Channel assignment updates are attempted on an Access Point. NOTE: hysteresis is built into the algorithms so we will not have unproductive changes occuring. Default value is 600 seconds

dca-contribution-noise.description:
State of noise on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled

dca-contribution-interference.description:
State of interference on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

dca-contribution-load.description:
State of load on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

dca-contribution-device.description:
State of device detection on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled.

txpower-mode.description:
Dynamic transmit power (DTP) has three modes. When the mode is auto, the transmit power of each Access Point will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the DTP is run once,transmit power update will occur based on the UPDATE_CMD received from the management. When the DTP is static, no dynamic transmit power updates occur and their global defaults are used. Default is auto.
         Possible values are:
         rrm-automatic = Automatic power selection
         rrm-run-once = Power selection is done only once
         rrm-static = Static power selection

monitor-channel-mode.description:
Channels on which the switch monitors noise, interference and rogues.
         Possible values:
         rrm-channels-country = Monitoring on channels that are supported by the country of operation,
         rrm-channels-all = Monitoring on all channels,
         rrm-channels-dca = Monitoring on those channels that are used by automatic channel assignment

monitor-rssi-normalization.description: 802.11 configured RRM Neighbor Discovery RSSI Normalization

channel-monitor-status.description:
Neighbor monitoring mode.
         True - monitoring is disabled
         False - monitoring is enabled

monitor-load-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) specifying how often we get new load measurements at each Access Point. Default is 300 seconds

monitor-coverage-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) specifying how often we get new coverage measurements at each Access Point. Default is 300 seconds

sys-log-load.description:
Logging mode for load profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-noise.description:
Logging mode for noise profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-foreign.description:
Logging mode for foreign profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-tx-power.description:
Logging mode for transmit power change.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-coverage.description:
Logging mode for coverage profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-performance.description:
Logging mode for performance profile.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

sys-log-channel.description:
Logging mode for dynamic channel change.
         True - logging is enabled
         False - monitoring is disabled

ndp-type-data.description:
Mode of NDP.
         Possible values:
         transparent = NDP mode is transparent
         protected = NDP mode is protected

roaming-en.description:
Optimized roaming mode.
         True - optimized roaming is enabled
         False - optimized roaming is disabled

data-rate-threshold.description:
This attribute indicates configured data rate threshold for 802.11 Optimized Roaming
         optroam-rate-1-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 1 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-2-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 2 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-5-5-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 5 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-6-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 6 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-9-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 9 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-11-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 11 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-12-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 12 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-18-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 18 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-24-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 24 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-36-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 36 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-48-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 48 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-54-m = Data rate threshold will be set to 54 Mbps.
         optroam-rate-0 = Data rate threshold will be set to 0 Mbps.

roaming-hysteresis.description: Hysteresis for optimized roaming. Recommended range is 3 dBm to 6 dBm.

rrm-meas-req-state.description: Support of 802.11 CCX Client Location Measurements

dca-long-interval.description: DCA interval value in hours. Possible values are 1,2,3,4,6,8,12 and 24 hours, 0 = 10 minutes (default).

dca-anchor-hour.description: Anchor time for DCA, hour of the day. Valid value should be in the range 0-23

dca-threshold.description:
Dynamic Channel Assignment sensitivity level to change in the environment
         dca-threshold-low = Low DCA sensitivity level.
         dca-threshold-medium = Medium DCA sensitivity level.
         dca-threshold-high = High DCA sensitivity level

coverage-global-enable.description:
State of CHD (Coverage Hole Detection) on the controller.
         True - detection is enabled
         False - detection is disabled

coverage-data-failed-packet-count.description: Minimum threshold on the Data packet count required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-data-failed-packet-percentage.description: Threshold on the percent of Data packets dropped, that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-data-packet-rssi-threshold.description:
RSSI threshold value for Data packets,
         that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.
         Use coverage-data-packet-rssi-threshold, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

coverage-voice-failed-packet-count.description: Minimum threshold on the Voice packet count required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-voice-failed-packet-percentage.description: Threshold on the percent of Voice packets dropped, that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.

coverage-voice-packet-rssi-threshold.description:
RSSI threshold value for Voice packets,
         that is required to trigger the CHD algorithm on the controller.
         Use coverage-voice-packet-rssi-threshold, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

dca-chan-width.description:
DCA channel width selection.
         Possible values:
         dca-chan-width-20mhz = Channel width will be set to 20Mhz
         dca-chan-width-40mhz = Channel width will be set to 40Mhz
         dca-chan-width-80mhz = Channel width will be set to 80Mhz
         dca-chan-width-best = Best channel width will be selected by DCA algorithm
         dca-chan-width-160mhz = Channel width will be set to 160Mhz
         Use rf-dca-chan-width, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

reporting-interval.description: Interval(in seconds) between each measurements report.

notification-tx-power-enable.description:
Transmission power change notification mode.
         True - notification is enabled
         False - notification is disabled

notification-min-tx-power-threshold.description: Minimum threshold that the TPC will assign to each radio

notification-max-tx-power-threshold.description: Maximum threshold that the TPC will assign to each radio

notification-channel-enable.description:
Channel change notification mode.
         True - notification will be sent
         False - notification will not be sent

notification-channel-threshold.description: Number of channel changes after which the channel change notification is sent out.

dpc-min-tx-power-limit.description: Lower limit of transmit power in dBm. The value should be less than equal to value of tx-power-max.

dpc-max-tx-power-limit.description: Upper limit of transmit power in dBm. The value should be greater than equal to value of tx-power-min.

dca-min-metric-rssi.description: Minimum RSSI energy metric required for DCA to change the channel

chan-width-cap.description: Max Best Channel Width Allowed for Dynamic Bandwidth Selection. Possible values are 20,40,80 and 160 MHZ

measurement-interval.description: Interval (in seconds) specifying how often we get new signal strength, noise and interference measurements at each Access Point.

neighbor-timeout-factor.description: Factor specifying how long a neighbor expires if not receiving its neighbor packets.

bss-color-mode.description: BSS Color Optimization (BCO) has two modes. When the mode is auto, the BSS color will be periodically updated for all Access Points that permit this operation. When the BCO is static, no dynamic BSS color selections occur and BSS color must be manually configured.

dca-aggr-startup.description: Aggressive DCA algorithm is run on WLC startup when enabled

rrm.description: All the basic rrm algorithms configurations.

exception-level.description:
Minimum percentage of clients in the coverage hole region of the AP,
         required to trigger a coverage hole exception.
         Use exception-level, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

min-num-clients.description:
Minimum number of clients required to trigger coverage hole.
         Use min-num-clients, present in container rf-profile-default-entries,
         part of Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rf-cfg model

automatic-cfg.description:
Performance profile Mode.
         True - Performance profile is enabled
         False - Performance profile is disabled

ip.description: IP address of the static member configured

name.description: Name of the static member configured

grouping-mode.description:
RF grouping has three modes. When RF grouping is set to AUTO the controller can be either in Auto leader or Auto member and when the mode is set to static the controller can be either in static member or static leader.
         Possible values:
         rrm-automatic = RF leader selected automatically
         rrm-static = RF leader selection is stopped
         rrm-leader = RF leader selection is static, and set this controller as group leader

grouping-update-interval-sec.description: The period used by the grouping algorithm. The grouping algorithm runs when the group contents changes and automatic grouping is enabled. The system administrator can start grouping on demand.

band.description:
Key to the st_rrm_mgr table ,indicates the band of the configurations.
         Possible values:
         ewlc-dot11-2-dot-4-ghz-band = 802.11bg
         ewlc-dot11-5-ghz-band = 802.11a
